title: The Rescue
dialogue_triumphs: Barbara, thinking the TARDIS has landed, tells the Doctor that the trembling has stopped. The Doctor replies: 'Oh my dear, I'm so glad you're feeling better.'
goofs: The TARDIS has no back to it, and you can see the cave wall beyond.
In episode two, a stagehand is visible behind Vicki's pet.
Barbara's shot at the sand creature is a firework which drops off the end of her gun.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord protagonist, traveling in the TARDIS
continuity_notes.current_status: Mentions not having a medical degree, dozes during TARDIS materialization

continuity_notes.name: Vicki
continuity_notes.description: New companion introduced in this story
continuity_notes.current_status: Orphaned on Dido, about to join the TARDIS crew

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space machine
continuity_notes.current_status: Lands itself for the first time

continuity_notes.name: Didonians
continuity_notes.current_status: Significantly reduced in number, previously peaceful

roots: It! The Terror from Beyond Space
links: Reference is made to Susan and her leaving the TARDIS
Ian and Barbara's departure from 1963 ('An Unearthly Child')
The crew's problems with caves ('The Daleks', 'Marco Polo')

locations.name: Dido
locations.description: Planet where the story takes place
locations.current_status: Site of a crashed spaceship and diminished native population

future_history: The crashed spaceship has a Union Jack flag. [Britain still exists in some form in 2493.]
untold_adventures: The Doctor has been to Dido before
additional_notes: Vicki left Earth for the planet Astra in 2493. Vicki's mother had recently died and her father was about to start a new job on Astra. He was among the people killed by Bennett. Vicki is not short for Victoria.
bottom_line: As a vehicle to introduce a companion, 'The Rescue' just about works, but it's too inconsequential to sustain any real interest.
